results.title: Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: David Telfer, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins relates survival stories in four episodes. ‘The “Coffee Royal” affair’ set in Western Australia traces the story of Charles Kingsford Smith whose reputation was damaged by one of Australia’s earliest aviation disasters. ‘The Cannibal convict’ tells of one of the earliest convict escapees, Alexander Pierce in the wilds of south-west Tasmania. The footsteps of determined explorer John McDouall Stuart is retraced in ‘The Best of them all.’ ‘The Dutch settlement’ follows clues across Australia to investigate a report made last century about a Dutch colony established in Central Australia following a shipwreck.

results.title: Carry on constable
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Peter Rogers Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Carry on”.
Fourth in the series of Carry On films, Carry on Constable plays host to the cast of ‘carry-oners’ whose camaraderie as actors made this series so successful. Sergeant Frank Wilkins (Sid James) receives three bumbling new recruits; Constable Charlie Constable (Kenneth Connor) who is plagued by superstitious fears, Constable Stanley Benson (Kenneth Williams) whose scientific deduction distracts him from the task at hand and Constable Tom Potter (Leslie Phillips) whose do-gooder intentions only ever create problems. Tested and exasperated the Sergeant follows the incompetent capers of the Constables into a farcical foray of chaos with much hilarity. Cast also includes: Eric Barker, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Hattie Jacques and Shirley Eaton.

results.title: Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 2]
results.creator_credit: David Telfer, Richard Walker, Jack King, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins travels Australia-wide tracking down stories of survival in the wilderness. “Gold Fever” looks at the legend of Lasseter’s lost reef of gold in Central Australia. “The Passionate Prussian” retraces Leichardt’s exploration from Moreton Bay to Point Essington and the mystery which shrouds his disappearance. “The Great Misadventure” looks at the ill-fated Burke and Wills expedition and how a knowledge of Bush Tucker may have changed the outcome. The final episode “Into the Vilest Country” features the Cape York Penninsula as Les travels to the area in a manner which contrasts that of the cumbersome Kennedy exploration.

results.title: From the Wet to the Top End
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Wild and spectacular countryside forms the backdrop for Les Hiddins’ adventures, including the rock pinnacles of a ‘Lost City’, enormous underground lava tubes and the rugged beauty of the Kimberleys. Les retells the often tragic social history of many of these remote places, such as the failed British garrison at Port Eisington. Along the way, his varied diet includes anything from Barramundi to the Tennis Ball fruit. We see how even Les gets bogged down in the wet lands of Cape York, and follow his explorations of an inland lake in an ingenious canoe made from tree bark.

results.title: From Arnhem Land to the Kimberley Ranges (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Smith, David Tunnell, David Leonard, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
On this video, containing the first four episodes of the series, Major Hiddins takes us into the heart of Arnhem Land where the Aborigines of Ngukurr reveal their bush tucker secrets. From there he moves to the north-west of the Northern Territory during the wet season and through some of the most arid desert country in Australia to the heart of the spectacular Kimberley Ranges.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ashley Smith, David Tunnell, David Leonard, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Follow that camel
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Peter Rogers Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
England, 1906, and all is not cricket. After being tricked and humiliated at a high society club during a cricket match, Bertram West aka Beau (Jim Dale), now disgraced, leaves with batsman Simpson (Peter Butterworth) to join the Foreign Legion to prove his worth. Hot on Beau’s tail is the regretful Lady Jane Ponsonby (Angela Douglas) who travels to restore his reputation whilst losing her own. The usual Carry On crew are joined by Phil Silvers who reprises the Sergeant Bilko character in his role as Sergeant Knocker. A strong performance but distracting from the usual Carry On style. A few saucy surprises along the way, like Anita Harris who, usually type-cast as the wholesome girl next door, plays the shock role (for it’s time), of the erotic belly dancer. Cast includes: Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims and Bernard Bresslaw.

results.title: From the rainforests to Cape York (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Smith, David Tunnell, David Leonard, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
This video, containing the last four episodes of the series, follows Major Hiddins through the most northern rainforest in Australia at Iron Range, the northern Queensland coastline and the Gulf country, through to the west coast of Cape York where the first known sighting of Australia took place by Europeans.

results.title: Carry on camping = Let sleeping bags lie
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Adder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The hilarity and double entendre’s fly fast and thick in this 19th film in the ‘Carry On’ series. Some well known gags abound, including the silhouetted tent scene that was reprised in the recent Austin Powers film, ‘The Spy Who Shagged Me’. Sid Boggle (Sidney James) and Bernie Lugg’s (Bernard Bresslaw) plans to trick their girlfriends (Joan Sims and Dilys Laye) into going on a camping trip for nudists (or so they believe), become unstuck. As a cast of characters converge on the campsite, like the ladies from Chayste Place, who are anything but - the fun erupts into a bawdy adventure. Cast also includes: Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Barbara Windsor, Hattie Jacques, Julian Holloway, Peter Butterworth and Betty Marsden.
results.title_for_label: Carry on camping = Let sleeping bags lie
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Rank Organisation Film Productions and Adder Productions

Some well known gags abound, including the silhouetted tent scene that was reprised in the recent Austin Powers film, ‘The Spy Who Shagged Me’. Sid Boggle (Sidney James) and Bernie Lugg’s (Bernard Bresslaw) plans to trick their girlfriends (Joan Sims and Dilys Laye) into going on a camping trip for nudists (or so they believe), become unstuck. As a cast of characters converge on the campsite, like the ladies from Chayste Place, who are anything but - the fun erupts into a bawdy adventure. Cast also includes: Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Barbara Windsor, Hattie Jacques, Julian Holloway, Peter Butterworth and Betty Marsden.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The hilarity and double entendre’s fly fast and thick in this 19th film in the ‘Carry On’ series. Some well known gags abound, including the silhouetted tent scene that was reprised in the recent Austin Powers film, ‘The Spy Who Shagged Me’. Sid Boggle (Sidney James) and Bernie Lugg’s (Bernard Bresslaw) plans to trick their girlfriends (Joan Sims and Dilys Laye) into going on a camping trip for nudists (or so they believe), become unstuck. As a cast of characters converge on the campsite, like the ladies from Chayste Place, who are anything but - the fun erupts into a bawdy adventure. Cast also includes: Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Terry Scott, Barbara Windsor, Hattie Jacques, Julian Holloway, Peter Butterworth and Betty Marsden.

results.title: Carry on screaming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
A virgin goes missing in the woods in this ‘Carry on’ spoof, leaving her boyfriend and two hopeless detectives in search of her. Their only clue is the remaining gruesome finger of a “homo-garganturoso” (an extinct hairy man) at the scene of the crime. They happen upon a spooky house, complete with expressionless butler, buxom vamp and an undead master of the house. When the lost finger is subjected to an electrical charge, another large hairy man is generated. Why does the mannequin resemble the missing girl and what is the vitrification process? The horror theme is made complete with the usual toilet humour and innuendo of the ‘Carry on’ crew. Cast includes Harry H. Corbett, Kenneth Williams and Joan Sims.
